content: the **crate socks** are simple ribbed socks with subtle twists in the ribbing pattern that create lovely texture and visual interest knitted cuff-down with a heel flap and gusset construction these socks offer an excellent fit and are perfect for sock knitting beginners or experienced knitters seeking a straightforward textured project the crate socks feature a woven ribbing stitch pattern throughout which gives the design its name this woven texture continues onto the heel flap for a practical yet delicate look while a wedge toe provides a neat finish the pattern includes instructions for the magic loop method but can be easily adapted to other sock knitting techniques **sizes** s m l xl stitch count 54 62 70 78 sts finished foot circumference unstretched approx 16 18 21 23 cm / 6 5 7 8 5 9 to fit foot circumference measured around the ball of the foot approx 19-22 21-24 24-27 26-29 cm / 7 5-9 8 5-9 5 9 5-11 10 5-11 5 the sample is in size s for a 21 cm foot circumference with 6 cm negative ease **yarn** 240 280 320 360 m / 262 306 350 394 yds of fingering weight sock yarn yardage will vary depending on leg and foot length the sample uses a sock yarn base 80% merino 20% nylon 400m / 437 yds per 100g / 3 5 oz color is hand-dyed by lois **needle** 2 25mm / us size 1 80cm / 32 circular needle for magic loop you can also use short circular needles or double-pointed needles but the instructions are written for the magic loop method
